meanings.definition: more fine or delicate in appearance or quality
meanings.sent1: The princess wore a finnier dress to the ball.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a finnier brush to create intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The delicate flower looked even finnier next to the bold sunflower.
meanings.sent4: Her finnier taste in art made her stand out among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The finnier lace on the dress shimmered under the lights.

meanings.definition: in a more fine or delicate manner
meanings.sent1: She handled the fragile vase finnier than anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The chef sliced the vegetables finnier than required for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: He moved through the crowd finnier, as if gliding on air.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed finnier than a gentle stream through the room.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved finnier than a feather in the breeze.

meanings.definition: a person or thing that is more fine or delicate in appearance or quality
meanings.sent1: The swan was known as the finnier of all the birds in the lake.
meanings.sent2: She was considered the finnier of the two sisters due to her elegant manners.
meanings.sent3: The antique vase was the finnier in the collection, attracting many admirers.
meanings.sent4: He was the finnier in the group, always dressed impeccably.
meanings.sent5: The finnier of the two paintings caught the eye of the art critic.
